text: Crown Princess Märtha is a bronze statue of Crown Princess Märtha of Norway, by Kirsten Kokkin. It is located at the Norwegian residence, located at Massachusetts Avenue and 34th Street, N.W. Washington, D.C.http://www.norway.org/ARCHIVE/News/archive/2005/marthastatue/ It was unveiled 18 September 2005. A copy at Palace Park Oslo, was unveiled by King Harald V of Norway on 21 February 2007, on his 70th birthday. A third example was unveiled in Stockholm on 30 October 2008.http://www.kokkinsculpture.com/events.html ==See also== * List of public art in Washington, D.C., Ward 2 ==References== ==External links== *Crown Princess Märtha of Norway, hmdb *HRH Princess Martha of Norway Statue, dahoovsplace *"What to see: Statue of Crown Princess Märtha, Oslo", trondni, 12 September 2010 *Crown Princess Märtha: The American Story, Georgia Public Broadcasting Category:2005 sculptures Category:Bronze sculptures in Washington, D.C.
